summary: An email forwarded to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) from the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) regarding allegations that a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) after-action team investigating Jeffrey Epstein's suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York was shredding boxes of paperwork related to the investigation. The email suggests this conduct may be inappropriate and warrants investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the suicide investigation at MCC New York. His death prompted the BOP after-action team investigation.

events.title: Alleged Document Shredding at MCC NY
events.description: A BOP after-action team investigating Epstein's suicide was allegedly shredding boxes of paperwork related to the investigation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. An inmate transport worker reported being told to help shred and observed bags of shredded paper being disposed of.

events.title: OIG Email Forward to US Attorney
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General forwards an allegation about document shredding by the BOP Epstein investigation team to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for potential investigation.

keyFacts: A BOP after-action team investigating Jeffrey Epstein's suicide at MCC New York was allegedly shredding boxes of paperwork related to that investigation.
An inmate transport worker reported the shredding occurred on a Thursday and Friday, and that he was told to help shred, with the worker stating, "they are shredding everything."

The Office of the Inspector General (OIG) forwarded this allegation to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), suggesting the conduct may be inappropriate and warrants investigation.
The document implies potential obstruction or improper evidence handling in the official investigation into Epstein's death.
The correspondence is dated August 19, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
